productDetails.heroImageAltText: The Ordinary Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1% Oil Control Serum
productDetails.imageAltText: The Ordinary - Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1% Oil Control Serum
productDetails.longDescription:
What it is: A high-strength vitamin-and-mineral blemish formula with 10 percent pure niacinamide and one percent zinc PCA.


Skin Type: Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily


Skincare Concerns: Pores and Oiliness


Highlighted Ingredients:
- Niacinamide (Vitamin B3): Reduces the appearance of skin blemishes and signs of congestion, visibly brightens skin tone.

- Zinc PCA: Visibly regulates excess sebum activity.


Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, phthalates, mineral oil, oxybenzone, coal tar, and sulfates SLS & SLES. It is also vegan, gluten-free, and cruelty-free.


What Else You Need to Know: Niacinamide (vitamin B3) reduces the appearance of skin blemishes and congestion. A high 10 percent concentration of this vitamin is supported in the formula by zinc PCA to balance visible aspects of sebum activity. This product is vegan, cruelty-free, and formulated without alcohol, silicone, nuts, gluten, and fragrance.
productDetails.shortDescription:
What it is: A high-strength vitamin-and-mineral blemish formula with 10 percent pure niacinamide and one percent zinc PCA.


Skin Type: Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily


Skincare Concerns: Pores and Oiliness


Highlighted Ingredients:
- Niacinamide (Vitamin B3): Reduces the appearance of skin blemishes and signs of congestion, visibly brightens skin tone.

- Zinc PCA: Visibly regulates excess sebum activity.


Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, phthalates, mineral oil, oxybenzone, coal tar, and sulfates SLS & SLES. It is also vegan, gluten-free, and cruelty-free.
productDetails.suggestedUsage:
Suggested Usage:
-Apply a few drops to entire face in morning and evening before heavier creams.


Precautions:

-If topical vitamin C is used as part of skincare, it should be applied at alternate times with this formula in the AM. Otherwise, niacinamide can affect integrity of pure-form vitamin C.

reviews.name: Must have
reviews.description: If you're looking for niacinamide, I highly recommend this product! It has been one of my best purchases.
I have used it before so good! Really affordable and one of my favorite brands!

reviews.name: Meanie
reviews.description: It made me blush and it was bad for my skin AND it had retinal amd the store person told me it was ok for my skin 😡😡😡😡😡😡

reviews.name: Doesn't do anything at all.
reviews.description: I've bought 60 ml this niacinamide serum, its already empty now and can't see any results. Literally doesnt do anything.

reviews.name: Helps with break outs and pores
reviews.description: I use this every day in the morning before putting on moisturizer and spf. I find that it clears out my break outs and helps with hyperpigmentation. It can feel drying at times, especially in the winter, so make sure to moisturize as needed!

reviews.name: Must Have
reviews.description: I love this product so much. It is so lightweight and goes on the skin bery nicely. A little bit goes a long way!

reviews.name: I'll be ordering more! love this
reviews.description: my first experience and it was great, I use it 2 times a week and I am very happy with it, it suited my skincare routine, my skin is now super smooth and soft! but again it is worth trying other products with similar ingredients first to know if it will work for you, I got this one because I have niacinamide in my cream

reviews.name: THIS HAS TO BE IN YOUR ROUTINE
reviews.description: I love this product so much it helped my skin look better than ever but sometimes it really drys up my face but thatâ€™s only sometimes but all and all I really love the product itâ€™s one of my favorites Sephora offers.

reviews.name: Not worth itâ€¦
reviews.description:
I tried to use this in place of a slightly more expensive serum, but unfortunately it was a no for me and I went back to my original one. This was super drying, and made my entire face peel (which no product has done that to my skin before). I guess the cheap price tag isnâ€™t always worth it.
